fields:
Intuition: Weight terms by frequency and rarity across documents
Formula: TF-IDF = TF × log(N/df)
Symbols: TF=term freq, N=total docs, df=docs with term
Use: Information retrieval and document similarity

Intuition: Map discrete tokens to dense continuous vectors
Property: Similar words have similar vectors
Training: Word2Vec (skip-gram/CBOW) or context prediction
Benefit: Captures semantic relationships in vector space

Skip-gram: Predict context words from target word
CBOW: Predict target word from context words
Training: Negative sampling or hierarchical softmax
Result: Dense vectors where similar words cluster together
What is the difference between Word2Vec and GloVe?

Word2Vec: Local context window, predictive model
GloVe: Global co-occurrence statistics, count-based
Training: Word2Vec uses SGD, GloVe uses matrix factorization
Performance: Often similar, GloVe more interpretable

Word2Vec: One vector per word type (fast, fixed)
Contextual: Different vectors per word occurrence
Example: "bank" (river) vs "bank" (money)
Trade-off: Contextual more accurate but computationally expensive
What is FastText and how does it differ from Word2Vec?

Innovation: Learns representations for character n-grams
Advantage: Handles out-of-vocabulary words
Subword info: "unhappy" = "un" + "happy" + word
Use case: Morphologically rich languages, rare words
